content.question: Two solid reactants of varying particle size are combined in a vessel. Assuming that the same mass of each reactant is used in each case, which of the following represents the conditions that will result in the fastest reaction rate?

choices.label: The figure shows a bowl that has 11 large sized particles inside it. The temperature is 950 degrees Celsius.
The figure shows a bowl that has 11 medium sized particles inside it. The temperature is 500 degrees Celsius.
The figure shows a bowl that has a large number of small particles in it. The temperature is 500 degrees Celsius.
The figure shows a bowl that has a large number of small particles in it. The temperature is 950 degrees Celsius.

content.answer: The figure shows a bowl that has a large number of small particles in it. The temperature is 950 degrees Celsius.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
